intro: Ichtyoselmis macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered ichthyoselmis, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbrella-like shapes. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp, typical of the Apiaceae family. Ichtyoselmis macrantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
